title: The formula given above is the item Index. Item Index is the…
caption_en: The formula given above is the item Index. Item Index is the moment of the item, loaded or unloaded. When an item is loaded, the Weight is positive. Conversely, if an item is unloaded from the aircraft after having work out the aircraft C of G trim, a negative sign is associated with the Weight. By doing that a new CG trim can be workout without error. ER 1 _

title: From the formula of the item index, it can be determined tha…
caption_en: From the formula of the item index, it can be determined that the reference datum of the aircraft is at fuselage station J 1 _

title: Recall in your basic that a clockwise moment about a fulcrum…
caption_en: Recall in your basic that a clockwise moment about a fulcrum is considered positive moment and anti-clockwise, negative moment. When items are loaded on the right of reference datum (on FS it will produce clockwise moment and, hence, a positive sign. Likewise, loading items on the left of datum will create anti-clockwise moment which will result in negative sign. EE 1 _

caption_en: Taking the lowest of the three Maximum Takeoff Weights, the Maximum Certified Takeoff Wt is used as the basis to determine the Allowed Traffic Load-764 kg. em an 1 _

caption_en: The flight consists of 3 passengers. For loadsheet purposes, each passenger weight is 77 kg. In addition, each passenger is entitled to 20 kg of baggage. That gives total baggage weight of 60 kg. Adding all three passengers weights gives kg. Total Traffic Load is kg. me an 1 _

caption_en: Referring to the INDEX TABLE for passenger, retrieve passengers weights and indices and fill them accordingly on the INDEX COMPUTATION. Notice that passengers indices are negative. This was explained earlier. Now add all the passengers indices. PE 1 _

caption_en: Going back to the INDEX TABLE again. A total of 60 kg passengers baggage is loaded into the Tail Baggage Area. To obtain 60 kg baggage index, we will have to add and (which are index units for 10 kg and 50 kg of baggage respectively). That gives Index Unit of (positive index). Alternatively, the Item Index formula may also be used to determine the baggage index. Transfer this figure to the INDEX COMPUTATION chart. PE 1 _

The intersection of the LITOW line and actual TOW line shows the position of the Takeoff Wt C of G. Ensure the C of G is within the envelop, otherwise re-trimming is required. PE 1 _
